module.name: LCLMemManager
module.short: Base class for a memory manager used in the LCL and its interfaces.

descr.p: lclmemmanager.pas contains classes and type used to define the base class for various memory managers used in the Lazarus Component Library (LCL) and its interfaces. An own memory manager is somewhat faster and makes debugging and profiling easier.
This file is part of the Lazarus Component Library (LCL).

element.name: PLCLMemManagerItem
element.short: Pointer to a TLCLMemManagerItem type.

element.name: TLCLMemManagerItem
element.short: Represents a memory manager item with a pointer to the next item in the list.

element.name: TLCLMemManagerItem.Next
element.short: Pointer to the next item in the memory manager.

element.name: TLCLMemManager
element.short: Template for memory manager implementations.

descr.p: TLCLMemManager is a class which provides a template for memory manager implementations used in the LCL. It is used as a base class for specialized memory managers in widgetset classes.

element.name: TStreamSizeType
element.short: Alias to the type used for stream sizes.

descr.p: PtrInt for FPC 2.04.02 or higher. LongInt for versions prior to FPC 2.04.02.

element.name: TExtMemoryStream
element.short: Implements an extended memory stream with a minimum growth factor.

element.name: TExtMemoryStream.Realloc
element.short: Reallocates memory for the stream using the specified capacity.

descr.p: Realloc is an overridden method in TExtMemoryStream. It ensures that the new Capacity is at least 25% larger than the existing Capacity. Realloc calls the inherited method to re-allocate memory to the size needed.

element.name: TExtMemoryStream.Realloc.Result
element.short: Pointer to the newly allocated memory for the stream.

element.name: TExtMemoryStream.Realloc.NewCapacity
element.short: New capacity requested in the method.

element.name: TExtMemoryStream.Capacity
element.short: Size of the allocated memory for the stream.

descr.p: Capacity is a public PtrInt property in TExtMemoryStream which contains the memory size allocated for the stream. Setting a new value for the property causes the Realloc method to be called to re-allocate memory to the requested value.
